message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Disagree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
I need to respond as a primary or secondary school teacher from Montenegro to these statements about AI in education. I should provide balanced, thoughtful responses that reflect the perspective of an educator who has considered both the benefits and risks of AI in educational settings.

Let me think through each statement:

[TT4G35A]: AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans - This is generally true. AI tools like ChatGPT can assist with generating ideas, structuring lessons, etc. I would agree with this.

[TT4G35B]: AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities - AI can help personalize content, though this depends on the specific tools. This is a reasonable statement to agree with.

[TT4G35C]: AI assists teachers in supporting students individually - AI can provide personalized feedback and support. I would agree with this.

[TT4G35D]: AI supports students with specific needs - AI can help with translation for multilingual learners, text-to-speech for students with special needs, etc. I would agree.

[TT4G35E]: AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks - This is quite true. Grading, attendance, record-keeping can be partially automated. I would agree.

[TT4G35F]: AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own - This is unfortunately true. Tools like ChatGPT can be used to generate work that students might claim as their own. This is a risk. I would agree or strongly agree.

[TT4G35G]: AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct - AI systems can make errors or give inappropriate suggestions. This is a valid concern. I would agree.

[TT4G35H]: AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions - AI systems can perpetuate biases in their training data. This is a real concern. I would agree.

[TT4G35I]: AI jeopardises the privacy and security of student data - There are legitimate concerns about data security with AI systems. I would agree.
